citation.article-title: Transfer of Chainia species to the genus Streptomyces with emended description of species

p.s: Description of Streptomyces fumigatiscleroticus (Pridham) nom. rev.

Streptomyces fumigatiscleroticus (fu. mi. ga'ti. scle. rot'i. cus. L. masc. n. fumus, smoke, steam; L. suf. atus, provided with; L. part. adj. fumigatus, smoked; L. neut. n. sclerotium; M. L. adj. fumigatiscleroticus, smoked sclerotium, referring to smoke colour and ability to form sclerotia)
The description is taken from information derived from Thirumalachar et al. (1966) and Ruan et al. (1985).
Aerobic, Gram-positive organism with extensively branched substrate and aerial mycelium.
Produces spiral spore chains and shows brownish-black crusty growth.
Degrades gelatin, starch, urea and xanthine.
Nitrate is reduced but hydrogen sulphide is not produced.

L-arabinose, glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannitol, mannose, sorbitol, sucrose and D-xylose are used as sole carbon sources but dulcitol, galactose, glycerol, inulin, meso-inositol, L-rhamnose, salicin and sucrose are not.

Acid is produced from D-lactose, D-mannitol, D-melibiose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-sorbitol and D-xylose but not from adonitol, dulcitol, meso-erythritol, meso-inositol and sucrose.
Shows antimicrobial activity against Bacillus subtilis, Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus but not against Candida albicans, Cryptococcus neoformans or Saccharomyces cerevisiae.
Type strain: ATCC 19345 (= DSM 43154 = IFO 12999 = KCC 3101 = RIA 884).
